alert.note: Alert for Alger; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 30 at 10:37PM EDT until March 31 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. The snow may mix with freezing rain and sleet late in the night and Friday morning. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow and mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations in excess of 6 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Marquette and Alger Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to 11 AM EDT Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow Friday night through Saturday morning could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact multiple commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches Friday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
